metadata.synopsis: Dialog with mizora at Wyrm's Rock near the entrance to Lower city. She is in human form. Wyll sees his father taken away, and Mizora tells him to meet him in camp.

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: Shit - I don't understand it. The blow should have knocked him out, not killed him.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Mizora responds with knowing silence - and a wide smile.*

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: No, no - this was your doing, wasn't it?

56.speaker: Mizora
56.text: You wound me, pup. I admired your father - he was a man of the people, the grandest of dukes.

94.speaker: Mizora
94.text: Hard to think he's forever lost to us.

1.speaker: Mizora
1.text: What did I tell you? A momentous occasion, I'm sure you agree.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: I've had enough, Mizora. What do you want?

111.speaker: Mizora
111.text: Your attention, little pup, nothing more. And you'll be glad to give it.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: I've had enough, Mizora. What do you want?

20.speaker: Mizora
20.text: Your attention, little pup, nothing more. And you'll be glad to give it.

70.speaker: Mizora
70.text: A man of the people, the grandest of dukes. Hard to think he's forever lost to us.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Are you saying my father's not gone for good?

52.speaker: Mizora
52.text: I'm saying that someone stepping off stage doesn't have to mean the end of their story.

32.speaker: Mizora
32.text: Meet me in your camp. I've got a devil of a proposal.

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: Damn right he is. And he better stay that way.

72.speaker: Mizora
72.text: You say that. But minds can change in the span of a snap.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora snaps her fingers with the word 'snap'.

10.speaker: Wyll
10.text: I don't understand. I meant to knock him out, not kill him.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Mizora responds with knowing silence - and a wide smile.*

30.speaker: Mizora
30.text: Go on up, pay Gortash a visit. A fete to remember, I guarantee.

21.speaker: Wyll
21.text: Mizora - I've had enough. You owe your life to me. Time to end the pact.

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: Bloody hells. Where are they taking him?

92.speaker: Mizora
92.text: Feeling cheeky, are we? Most unbecoming.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: Mizora - I've had enough. You promised my freedom. Time to end the pact.

41.speaker: Mizora
41.text: Go on up, pay Gortash a visit. A fete to remember, I guarantee.

42.speaker: Mizora
42.text: Poor little Wyll. Such a tragedy - your own father, cut down in his prime. Damn shame, if you ask me.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Mizora. Spare me your fake sympathy.

47.speaker: Mizora
47.text: If it isn't little Wyll. Straight to your handler, and I didn't even have to whistle.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: Mizora - I've had enough. You owe your life to me. Time to end the pact.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: Mizora - I've had enough. You promised my freedom. Time to end the pact.

90.speaker: Mizora
90.text: Poor thing. You've had a tough go - and you don't know the half of it.

13.speaker: Mizora
13.text: You see, Gortash has had your father... relocated.

53.speaker: Mizora
53.text: To the slaughter, the way I hear it.

86.speaker: Mizora
86.text: Your dad's good as dead, pup. And to think there's no way to save him.
86.context: NodeContext: Very cheekily. She know she holds all the cards

84.speaker: Mizora
84.text: I know enough. I'll be in your camp if you want to work something out.

65.context: CinematicNodeContext: A diabolical circle draws underneath Mizora. She descends into it and it closes behind her.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Already? I thought Gortash would want to keep him around.

81.speaker: Mizora
81.text: I'm just an impartial observer - this is Gortash's game. A murderous one, the way I hear it.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Relocated? What are you playing at, devil?

98.speaker: Mizora
98.text: Rude. I'm just an impartial observer - this is Gortash's game. A murderous one, the way I hear it.

108.speaker: Mizora
108.text: Feeling cheeky, are we? Most unbecoming.

29.speaker: Mizora
29.text: Heard about your father. The Absolute's puppet - a damned travesty if you ask me.

110.speaker: Mizora
110.text: He's upstairs in Wyrm's Rock, ordaining Gortash as Archduke.

85.speaker: Mizora
85.text: A splendid party, I hear - perfect for crashing. Go on up. We'll talk after.

54.speaker: Mizora
54.text: If it isn't little Wyll. Straight to your handler, and I didn't even have to whistle.

2.speaker: Mizora
2.text: Poor thing. You've had a tough go - and you don't know the half of it.

57.speaker: Mizora
57.text: You see, Gortash has had your father... relocated.

11.speaker: Mizora
11.text: To the slaughter, the way I hear it.

66.speaker: Mizora
66.text: Your dad's good as dead, pup. And to think there's no way to save him.
66.context: NodeContext: Very cheekily. She know she holds all the cards

38.speaker: Mizora
38.text: I know enough. I'll be in your camp if you want to work something out.

101.speaker: Wyll
101.text: I'll do anything to save him. Name your price!

60.speaker: Mizora
60.text: You want to save your father, meet me in camp. Maybe we can work something out.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: Who knows? Let him die for all I care.

9.speaker: Mizora
9.text: Meet me in your camp - I'll lay everything out.

80.speaker: Mizora
80.text: The Duke's life is not all that's at stake.

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: Already? I thought Gortash would want to keep him around.

87.speaker: Mizora
87.text: I'm just an impartial observer - this is Gortash's game. A murderous one, the way I hear it.

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: What in the hells are you playing at, Mizora?

46.speaker: Mizora
46.text: Rude. I'm just an impartial observer - this is Gortash's game. A murderous one, the way I hear it.

45.speaker: Mizora
45.text: Heard about your father. The Absolute's puppet - a damned travesty if you ask me.

6.speaker: Mizora
6.text: He's upstairs in Wyrm's Rock, ordaining Gortash as Archduke.

49.speaker: Mizora
49.text: A splendid party, I hear - perfect for crashing. Go on up. We'll talk after.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: Mizora. Spare me your fake sympathy.

64.speaker: Mizora
64.text: Poor little Wyll. Such a tragedy - your own father, cut down in his prime. Damn shame, if you ask me.

93.speaker: Mizora
93.text: What did I tell you? A momentous occasion, I'm sure you agree.

3.speaker: Mizora
3.text: And the drama's not over, not by a long shot.

89.speaker: Wyll
89.text: Shit - I don't understand it. The blow should have knocked him out, not killed him.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Mizora responds with knowing silence - and a wide smile.*

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: No, no - this was your doing, wasn't it?

34.speaker: Mizora
34.text: You wound me, pup. I admired your father - he was a man of the people, the grandest of dukes.

75.speaker: Mizora
75.text: Hard to think he's forever lost to us.

39.speaker: Mizora
39.text: I'm saying that someone stepping off stage doesn't have to mean the end of their story.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Are you saying Ravengard's not gone for good?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Damn right he is. And he better stay that way.

8.speaker: Mizora
8.text: You say that. But minds can change in the span of a snap.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora snaps her fingers with the word 'snap'.

71.speaker: Mizora
71.text: Meet me in your camp. I've got a devil of a proposal.
